III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation When a youth returned from AWOL on 05/20/2025, it was found
she had a list of staff personal phone numbers.
Investigation Interviews:
Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed via phone on May 22,
2025. Foster Care Worker 1 reported Youth C returned from AWOL
on May 20, 2025, and it was found she had a list of staff member’s
personal phone numbers. She reported a staff member at the facility
reported this but could not remember who that was. Foster Care
Worker 1 reported she is concerned about this as she believes staff
should maintain professional boundaries with Youth C.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at her new facility on June
4, 2025. Youth C reported she was told by Foster Care Worker 1 that
she was going to be moving out of the facility. She reported when
she found this information out, she started asking staff for their phone
numbers so she could continue using them as a support. Youth C
reported many staff told her they could not provide their phone
number to her because it was against agency policy. She reported
she continued to ask the staff, and she was able to get Staff 2, Staff
6, Staff 10, Staff 11, Staff 14, Staff 15, and Staff 16’s phone
numbers. Youth C reported she formed a positive relationship with
these staff and wanted to maintain that connection when she moved
away. She denied ever asking Foster Care Worker 1 if these staff
were allowed to be on her contact list.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Staff 6 reported she was made aware by Supervisor that her
2

name and phone number were listed on a handwritten note that law
enforcement found on Youth C when she returned from AWOL on
May 20, 2025. She denied ever giving this information to Youth C
and noted she does not even want the youth to know her first name.
Staff 6 reported she believes Youth C obtained this information from
hacking a computer at the school where she found staff personal
information. She reported she would never provide this information to
youth because it is against policy and is completely unprofessional.
Staff 6 reported she is going to school to become a social worker and
would not want to jeopardize her career with an action like this.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 2
reported she was unaware Youth C had her phone number. She
denied ever giving her phone number to Youth C. Staff 2 reported
staff are not allowed to share personal information with the youth.
Staff 10 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 10
reported he was aware Youth C had his phone number because he
gave her his phone number to call in case, she ever needed support.
He reported he was never told he could not share his phone number
with the youth. Staff 10 reported other staff provided their phone
numbers to Youth C but did not want to confirm which staff did this.
He reported he only gave her his phone number for her to have a
number in case she was ever in trouble.
Staff 11 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 11
reported her last day of working at the facility was May 17, 2025. She
reported she received a phone call from Youth C on May 18, 2025.
Staff 11 reported she does not know how Youth C obtained her
phone number and denied ever providing it to her. She reported
when Youth C called her, she reported she was AWOL, and Staff 11
called law enforcement about the information.
Staff 14 was attempted to be interviewed via phone on May 30,
2025, and June 13, 2025. Voicemails were left and Staff 14 never
returned a phone call back.
Staff 15 was attempted to be interviewed via phone on May 30,
2025. Staff 15’s phone was disconnected and no longer works at
the facility.
Staff 16 was attempted to be interviewed via phone on May 30,
2025. Staff 16’s phone was disconnected and no longer works at
the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth D reported staff have never provided her with their
personal contact information such as their personal phone number.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Staff 5 reported he is unaware of any staff providing their
3

phone numbers to the youth at the facility. He reported staff are not
allowed to provide personal contact information to the youth.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via phone on May 27, 2026.
Administrator 2 reported she was made aware when Youth C
returned from AWOL on May 20, 2025, that police had found a
handwritten list of staff’s personal phone numbers in her pocket when
they completed a body search. She reported she is unaware of how
Youth C obtained these phone numbers and stated staff are not
allowed to provide personal information to the youth at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from Administrator 1 dated May 28, 2025- The
handwritten note law enforcement found on Youth C when
she returned from AWOL on May 20, 2025, had the names
and phone numbers to four current staff and three staff that no
longer works at the facility. The four staff members that
currently work at the facility are Staff 2, Staff 6, Staff 10 and
Staff 14. The three staff members that no longer work at the
facility are Staff 11, Staff 15, and Staff 16.
- Human Resource File for Staff 2- Staff 2 has only received
verbal waring for attendance issues. She is up to date on all
required trainings.
- Human Resource File for Staff 6- Staff 6 has only received a
verbal warning within her HR file on 04/05/2025 due to
attendance issues. She is up to date on all required trainings.
- Human Resource File for Staff 10- Staff 10 has no
disciplinary actions noted within his HR file. He is up to date
on all required trainings.
- Human Resource File for Staff 11- Staff 11 has only
received verbal waring for attendance issues. She is up to
date on all required trainings prior to leaving the facility.
- Human Resource File for Staff 14- Staff 14 has only
received verbal waring for attendance issues. She is up to
date on all required trainings.
- Human Resource File for Staff 15- Staff 15 has received a
verbal warning for leaving his cell phone unattended and a
written warning for cell phone usage. He was up to date on all
required training prior to leaving the facility.
- Human Resource File for Staff 16- Staff 16 had no
disciplinary actions noted within her HR file. She was up to
date on all required trainings prior to leaving the facility.
- Facility Staff and Client Interaction Policy dated January
2023- Within this policy it notes that staff should never give
4

out personal telephone numbers, addresses, or social media
profile information to clients.
Analysis Rule violation was established as it was found within the
interviews of Youth C and Staff 10 that staff was sharing their
personal cell phone numbers with Youth C. This goes against the
facility’s internal policy of staff and client interactions.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There were multiple AWOLs over the weekend and a riot. It is
reported that the unit was destroyed by the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Law Enforcement was interviewed via phone on May 19, 2025.
Law Enforcement reported over the past weekend, their office was
called multiple times by the facility for AWOL reports and a potential
riot that occurred.
MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on May 19, 2025.
MDHHS Worker reported she heard from a previous staff member
who heard from a current staff member, that over the weekend, the
facility had multiple youth who AWOL’d, and some of the youth
began to riot. She reported there was many leadership members at
the facility trying to support the youth, but the youth began doing
property destruction. MDHHS Worker reported law enforcement was
contacted but refused to come to the campus of the facility. She
reported she does not know the name of the staff member who
reported the initial concern.
Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed via phone on May 22,
2025. Foster Care Worker 1 reported she was present at the facility
on May 18, 2025, to complete a visit with Youth C. She reported
there were multiple youth at the facility being assaultive towards
youth and doing some intense property damage. Foster Care Worker
1 reported when she was leaving the facility when Youth C attempted
to AWOL and was being followed by staff. She reported at one point
Clinical Supervisor called her to ask how to handle Youth C’s
behaviors. Foster Care Worker 1 reported she finds this concerning
and felt that the youth are not safe at the facility.
5

Foster Care Worker 2 was interviewed via phone on May 23,
2025. Foster Care Worker 2 reported she is the foster care worker for
Youth A. She reported she feels the facility can meet the needs of
Youth A and keep her safe. Foster Care Worker 2 reported Youth A
complains about the facility and wants to move but she notes she
has a positive relationship with staff there.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Youth A reported she wanted to be moved from this facility and
did not want to talk with this consultant about what happened over
the weekend.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Youth B reported staff are doing their best on trying to keep
the youth safe but this past weekend the youth took over the
campus. She reported the youth in her unit started breaking windows
and doors down to try to escape and conducting property damage to
cars and buildings. Youth B did not want to name specific names of
the youth. She reported she did get overwhelmed by the situation
and joined some of the negative behavior. Youth B reported she
jumped out the window to try to AWOL, but the staff did try to redirect
her to make better choices. She reported she could not remember
what staff were working that day or who encouraged her to do better.
Youth B reported due to all the chaos going on staff from the
leadership team and police came to assist.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at her new facility on June
4, 2025. Youth C reported there was not enough staff at the facility to
keep the youth safe. She reported staff did attempt to verbally
redirect her from running away but did not stop her. Youth C reported
some of the staff told her to run away because they did not want to
deal with her behaviors. She could not remember which staff had told
her this. Youth C refused to talk about the property damage that
occurred and just noted that staff tried to verbally deescalate. She
noted that staff never restrained a youth for breaking items on the
unit.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth D reported she joined in with her peers when they were
attempting to run away over the weekend on May 17, 2025 and May
18, 2025. She reported she could not remember what staff she was
working with, but the staff continued to try to redirect her back into
the building. Youth D denied ever being out of the eyesight of staff.
Youth E was attempted to be interviewed on May 20, 2025, at the
facility but she was outside with staff attempting to AWOL from
the facility. Youth E was attempted to be interviewed again on
May 27, 2025, at the facility but refused and had dysregulated
unsafe behaviors.
6

Youth F was attempted to be interviewed on May 20, 2025, at the
facility but she was outside with staff attempting to AWOL from
the facility. Youth F was attempted to be interviewed again on
May 27, 2025, at the facility but refused and had dysregulated
unsafe behaviors.
Youth G was attempted to be interviewed at the facility on May
20, 2025, and May 27, 2025, but she refused to talk with this
consultant.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
May 20, 2025. Administrator 1 reported he was not present at the
facility over the weekend but did hear about the reported concerns on
May 19, 2025. He reported the facility complied with their staff-to-
youth ratio over this past weekend. Administrator 1 reported within
their policy states their ratio is one staff to four youth, but they try to
staff the units with one staff to three youth. He reported over the
weekend there were eight youth placed at the facility and three of
those youth were on one-to-one staff. Administrator 1 reported he
had six to seven direct care staff working on the unit and one
supervisor on shift. He reported the supervisor does not count
towards the staff to youth ratio. The three youth that were on one-to-
one status were Youth B, Youth D, and Youth E.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
20, 2025. Supervisor reported she was called in by multiple staff for
support on May 17, 2025, and May 18, 2025. Supervisor reported
she did come onto campus both days to help the staff. She reported
she witnessed staff trying to verbally deescalate the youth from
leaving the unit and causing property damage. Supervisor reported
she witnessed staff follow youth off grounds due to AWOL concerns.
She reported the agency was in staff-to-youth ratio compliance, but
they were lacking in staff to handle the behavior of the youth.
Supervisor reported the facility has lost much of their staffing due to
the acuity of behaviors of the youth. She reported when the police
were at the facility, the youth showed no fear and continued to
engage in property damage to cars.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Staff 1 reported she was working the second shift on Saturday,
May 17, 2025. She reported the facility complied with their ratio
standards for youth to staff, but the youth were out of control. Staff 1
reported she heard rumors from the day before the youth wanted to
plan to try to AWOL because they could not go to a party at the
school. She reported on Saturday, May 17, 2025 when the youth
started to attempt to AWOL, a campus clear was called meaning
everyone was on lockdown and the gate to the entrance of the facility
was locked. Staff 1 reported she cannot remember any of the specific
situations that occurred but knows that staff tried their best to keep
the youth safe. She reported the youth were kicking down doors and
7

breaking windows. Staff 1 reported leadership was called, and
campus-wide supervisors and extended leadership arrived for
support. She reported the police were contacted and the youth
continued to be aggressive and destroyed property. Staff 1 reported
the facility did the best they could with the behaviors of the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Staff 2 reported she worked on Saturday, May 17, 2025. She
reported the facility was in ratio, but the facility did not have adequate
staffing for the behaviors the youth were showing. Staff 2 reported all
the events of that day were a blur due to the behaviors of the youth.
She reported the youth were breaking down doors, breaking
windows, jumping out of the windows, attempting to AWOL, and
destroying property to cars in the parking lot. She reported she
witnessed staff trying to intervene with verbal de-escalation with the
youth. Staff 2 reported staff were trying to encourage youth to make
positive choices. Staff 2 reported there was a call made for extra
staffing support and leadership came in to help support. There is a
lack of overall staffing because staff are quitting due to being burnt
out from the behaviors of the youth. Staff 2 reported the police also
came to the facility due to the behaviors of the youth but that didn’t
stop the behaviors of the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Staff 3 reported she worked on Sunday, May 18, 2025. She
confirmed the facility was in compliance with staff-to-youth ratio. Staff
3 reported the behaviors of the youth had escalated to the point
where extra support from leadership and police were contacted. She
reported she could not remember any specific incidents she was a
part of besides Youth A attempting to AWOL. Staff 3 remembered
staff were following Youth A, but she was not involved within this
situation.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Staff 4 reported she worked on Saturday, May 17, 2025, and
came in for support on Sunday, May 18, 2025. She reported the
whole weekend was a bit of a blur due to all the behaviors from
youth. Staff 4 reported she tried to use verbal de-escalation with the
youth, but one youth would be breaking down a door while the other
was breaking down the window. She reported there was not enough
staffing to help with the behaviors of the youth. Staff 4 reported police
did come to the facility to help but the youth were darting from the
police.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
27,2025. Staff 5 reported he was scheduled to work the afternoon
shifts on May 17, 2025 and May 18, 2025. He reported on both days
he was the staff following the youth outside when they got off the
grounds. Staff 5 reported throughout the weekend he followed each
youth from the unit off the grounds. He reported he attempted to
8

verbally redirect the youth to come back and talk to them about the
dangers out in the community. Staff 5 reported there was one point
where eyesight was lost on Youth C and Youth G when they were off
the facility grounds. He reported the police were called to help
support finding the youth. Staff 5 reported that Youth C and Youth G
did stay off the grounds overnight and were considered AWOL. He
reported he was involved with different youth who were destroying
property. Staff 5 reported he had tried to verbally deescalate several
youth from breaking windows on the unit. He reported that himself
and other staff tried to do their best with verbal de-escalation of trying
to encourage the youth to make positive choices, but the youth were
not responding. Staff 5 reported he never restrained a youth due to
property damage or witnessed another staff complete a restraint due
to property damage.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Staff 6 reported she was working on May 17, 2025. She
reported the night before she heard the youth plan to AWOL and she
made Supervisor aware of this. Staff 6 reported on May 17, 2025,
she witnessed Youth C and Youth G trying to break down the door.
She reported she tried to verbally redirect them. Staff 6 reported
during that time Youth B had broken the window and escaped
building. She stated then she turned around and the door had been
broken. Staff 6 reported she tried to encourage the youth to come
back, and they all had backpacks on. She reported one of the youth,
she could not remember which one, stated they would come back
that night as they were going to smoke marijuana. Staff 6 reported
she followed all three youth with other staff outside. She stated she
had entered into the agency van to try to find them when other staff
were out on foot. Staff 6 reported she felt the unit was understaffed
with the behaviors of the youth.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
27,2025. Therapist reported she had been contacted by Supervisor
about the need for extra support on campus on May 18, 2025. She
reported when she arrived at the facility, the youth had been breaking
windows and walking out of the buildings. Therapist reported she
walked with Youth A around campus to try to get her to come back
into the facility. She reported she came in to provide extra support to
the unit because the behaviors of the youth had escalated to the
point of needing more support on campus. Therapist had reported
she witnessed staff using their verbal de-escalation skills with the
youth to encourage youths to make positive choices.
Administrator 2 was interviewed via phone on May 27, 2026.
Administrator 2 reported she came to support staff on May 17, 2025,
and May 18, 2025, due to the escalated behaviors of the youth. She
reported she was notified by Supervisor of the need for extra support
at the facility. Administrator 2 reported she could not remember
exactly what happened on which day but did note all the youths’
9

behaviors had been escalated. She reported when she arrived on
campus the youth were breaking out windows and jumping out of the
units. Administrator 2 reported she saw multiple staff following the
youth around campus and off campus trying to verbally de-escalate.
She reported remembered trying to talk down Youth G from breaking
windows and running around campus. Administrator 2 reported staff
were trying their best to help follow youth both on foot and in agency
vehicles and there were multiple extra people who came to the
facility to help assist with the behaviors of the youth.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
27,2025. Staff 7 reported he was not scheduled to work at the facility
over the weekend but came in for extra support on Sunday May 18,
2025. He reported when he arrived to the facility there were multiple
staff outside with the youth, so he went into the building to help
maintain supervision of the youth who remained inside. Staff 7
reported there was much property damage done by the youth and
noted there was law enforcement present providing support.
Manager 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
27,2025. Manager 1 reported she was called by Supervisor for extra
support. She reported she came in both May 17, 2025, and May 18,
2025. Manager 1 reported on May 17, 2025, she worked with Youth
B trying to get her inside the building again after she jumped out of
the broken window. She reported on May 18, 2025, she was out with
staff off-grounds trying to get the youth who had AWOL back to the
facility. Manager 1 reported there were many staff on campus trying
to help with the situation, but the youth’s behaviors escalated. She
reported there were multiple staff following youth around campus and
off campus both on foot and within the agency vans.
Manager 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 27,
2025. Manager 2 reported she was called by Supervisor to come to
the facility on Sunday, May 18, 2025, to provide extra support. She
reported during that day she walked around with Youth D around
campus trying to verbally de-escalate her. Manager 2 reported staff
were doing the best they could do with all the escalated behaviors of
the youth.
Security Supervisor was interviewed via phone on May 27, 2025.
Security Supervisor reported she came to the facility on Sunday, May
18, 2025, to provide extra support. She reported when she arrived
several of the youth were already off campus grounds and staff were
following on foot or in an agency van. Security Supervisor reported
she did walk around campus with one youth with other staff trying to
calm her down. She reported she could not remember the name of
the youth. Security Supervisor reported some of the youth did break
the windshields on the agency vans and the police had to be
contacted.
10

Clinical Supervisor was interviewed via phone on May 27, 2025.
Clinical Supervisor reported she came in for support due to the
reported escalated behaviors of the youth. She reported when she
came onto campus on May 18, 2025, Youth C was powering walking
off campus. Clinical Supervisor reported she followed her with other
staff up to a gas station. She reported she was able to get Youth C
back into the agency van to come back to campus. Clinical
Supervisor reported Youth C began to throw things when she arrived
back to the facility. She reported she did call Foster Care Worker 1
for support on how to help calm Youth C down. Clinical Supervisor
reported she was trying to keep Youth C’s worker up to date as she
had just left from visiting Youth C at the facility. She reported she
was trying to think outside the box on how to support Youth C.
Human Resource Worker was interviewed via phone on May 27,
2025. Human Resource Worker reported she was at the facility over
the weekend due to dealing with an HR issue. She reported that is
when she witnessed a youth had broken the windshield on her car.
Human Resource Worker reported she witnessed staff try to verbally
intervene with the youth causing property damage. She did not know
the name of the staff or youth that were involved in the property
damage she witnessed.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 8
reported she was working at the unit on May 18, 2025, when she was
called over to provide support. She reported when she arrived, there
were multiple youth breaking the windows and doors at the facility.
Staff 8 reported some of the youth left the unit, but she stayed back
with the other youth still present in the unit. She reported she tried to
use the verbal de-escalation skill set they are trained at the facility to
use in order to deescalate the youth. Staff 8 reported that staff are
not allowed to restrain a youth due to property damage. She reported
the facility was understaffed to provide support for the youth.
Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 9
reported he worked on May 17, 2025. He reported he was involved
when Youth C and Youth G had run off the unit. Staff 9 reported
Youth C and Youth G had jumped the fence and then went into the
woods. He reported when they jumped the fence there was another
staff, who could not remember who, that was on the other side to
maintain the eyesight of the youth. Staff 9 reported Youth C and
Youth G did return to the facility by law enforcement. He reported he
felt like there was not enough staff at the facility to provide proper
care and support to the youth.
Staff 12, Staff 13, and Staff 14 were all attempted to be
interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025, and June 13, 2025. A
voicemail was left each time with no return phone call.
11

Video Review:
- Video record of May 17, 2025 during the time of 12:00pm
to 2:00pm was reviewed by this consultant. This video
recording was consistent with MiSACWIS report 213020262.
At the start of the video, Youth B is seen laying on the couch
in the main area and Staff 2 is supervising. Around 12:23pm,
Youth B begins pacing around the room and there are more
staff that arrive to the unit. At around 12:25pm, Youth B went
into another side room and came back to the main area with a
piece of wood. Staff 2 and Staff 5 are witnessed talking with
Youth B and Staff 5 was able to get the wood out of Youth B’s
hands. Youth B then went back into the room to get another
piece of wood and continued to use that piece of wood to pry
open the wood that was covering the broken window. Youth B
then leaves the area and engages in conversation with Staff
2. Staff 5 is witnessed cleaning up the area of the broken
wood. Due to encryption and length of video, the videos could
not be uploaded to the case file.
- Video record of May 17, 2025 during the time of 2:00pm to
3:30pm was reviewed by this consultant. This video
recording was consistent with MiSACWIS reports 213020264
and 21302063. Within the video it is seen Youth C and Youth
G are sitting by the exit door and appears to be trying to break
parts of the door hinge off. Staff 6 and Staff 14 are witnessed
within the video trying to verbally engage with the two youth.
Staff 1 and Staff 5 enter the unit as well to try to deescalate
around 2:50pm. Youth C and Youth G are witnessed kicking
the door and able to get out the building at 3:00pm. All staff
followed the youth and Staff 14 stayed back on the unit. Due
to encryption and length of video, the videos could not be
uploaded to the case file.
- Video record of May 18, 2025 during the time of 8:00pm to
10:00pm was reviewed by this consultant. This video
recording was consistent with MiSACWIS report 212960273.
Within the video recording there are multiple youth outside the
building while Youth G and Youth A are inside the building. It
is seen that one of the youth outside the building had broken
the glass window to assist with getting Youth G and Youth A
outside the building. It is witnessed there are multiple staff
outside and inside the building with the youth. Due to
encryption and length of video, the videos could not be
uploaded to the case file.
12

- Video record of May 18, 2025 during the time of 1:30pm to
3:30pm was reviewed by this consultant. This video
recording was consistent with facility’s internal incident report
